isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - TRAILER CONNECTION

svcsubproc.title: RED Terminal - Stop Light
svcsubproc.para: When the tractor brakes are applied, the vehicle stoplight switch supplies power through circuit 70A/70D to energize the Stop Light Relay (464-R10). With the Stop Light Relay energized, power from the B1 battery Stud, circuit 14K/14F, fuse F7-D, and circuit 70E is sent through the normally open contacts of Stop Light Relay on circuit 70C to trailer socket connector (112) at REDterminal.

svcsubproc.title: YELLOW & GREEN Terminals - Turn and Hazard Lights
svcsubproc.para: In the LEFT TURN mode (or hazard switch ON), power flows from B1 Battery Stud through circuit 14K, 14R, fuse F2-D, circuit 55, Flasher, circuit 55A and 14BK to Turn Signal Switch. From the switch it flows through circuit 56E to energize relay (464-R11). With the Left Turn Relay energized, power flows from B1 battery Stud through circuit 14K, 14L, fuse F7-B, circuit 56H, through normally open contacts of Left Turn Relay, and circuit 56C to the trailer socket (112), Yellow terminal.

In the RIGHT TURN mode (or hazard switch ON), power flows from B1 Battery Stud through circuit 14K, 14R, fuse F2-D, circuit 55, Flasher, circuit 55A and 14BK to Turn Signal Switch. From the switch it flows through circuit 57E to energize relay (464-R12). With the Right Turn Relay energized, power flows from B1 battery Stud through circuit 14K, 14L, fuse F7-C, circuit 57H, through normally open contacts of Right Turn Relay, and circuit 57C to the trailer socket (112), Green terminal.

svcsubproc.title: BROWN Terminal - Tail Light
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight and trailer light switches are closed, power flows from B2 battery stud through circuit 14H, 14D, fuse F8-A, and circuit 50 to headlight switch (465). It then flows out of the switch through circuit 58E, cab and trailer lights switch (466), and circuit 58P to energize tail light relay (464-R9). When relay energizes, power flows from B2 battery stud through circuit 14H, 14B, fuse F3-C, and circuit 68 to tail light relay. Power then flows through relay normally open contacts, circuit 68E, and 68B to the Brown terminal of trailer socket (112).

note.para: The Cab Trailer Lights Switch is a momentarily open interrupter switch.

svcsubproc.para: Depressing the switch will interrupt the power to the trailer socket brown terminal.

svcsubproc.title: BLACK Terminal - Marker Light
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight and trailer light switches are closed, power flows from B2 battery stud through circuit 14H, 14D, fuse F8-A, and circuit 50 to headlight switch (465). It then flows out of the switch through circuit 58E, cab and trailer lights switch (466), and circuit 58C to energize trailer marker lights relay (463-R8). When relay energizes, power flows from B2 battery stud through circuit 14H, 14E, fuse F3-A, circuit 58D, relay (463-R8), circuit 58R, 58S, and 58R to the trailer socket Black terminal.

svcsubproc.title: BLUE Terminal - Trailer Auxiliary, Truck Body Or Sleeper Box
svcsubproc.para: With ignition key ON or in accessory position and trailer auxiliary switch ON, power flows from A1 through circuit 12B, fuse F10-A, circuit 72A, trailer auxiliary switch (418), circuit 72B, 72C, and 72 to the trailer socket Blue terminal.

svcsubproc.title: WHITE Terminal - Trailer Socket Ground
svcsubproc.para: Without a sleeper box, the White terminal of (112) is grounded through circuit 11-GN to the trailer socket ground inside the cab and 11-GN and 11-G1 to ground stud at left dash panel.

With a 48 or 60 inch flat roof sleeper box, the White terminal of (112) is grounded through circuit 11-GK to the sleeper ground through circuit 11-GK, 11-GJ, and 11-GAN to the trailer socket ground inside the cab, and 11-GN and 11-G1 to ground stud at left dash panel.

With box, the White terminal of (112) is grounded through circuit 11-GN to trailer socket ground inside sleeper, circuit 11-GN to the sleeper ground, through circuit 11-GK, 11-GAN to the trailer socket ground inside the cab, and 11-GN and 11-G1 to ground stud at left dash panel.
With frame mounted connector for Four Wheel Trailer, the White terminal of (112) is grounded through circuit 11-GN to junction block ground.
